model

Class Labyrinth

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Labyrinth

  • public class Labyrinth
extends java.lang.Object
    Create the graph representing the labyrinth using the SimpleGraph class. Also contains all the required methods to check what contains the labyrinth as well as the Manhattan algorithm.
    Author:
    Pierre Lorson, Teiki Pepin

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • Labyrinth

        private Labyrinth()
        Create a Labyrinth.

        Warning : as we're using the Singleton design pattern, this method should not be called directly. Use getInstance instead.

    • Method Detail

      • buildLabyrinth

        private void buildLabyrinth(Vertex vertex)
        Updates the graph representing the labyrinth by building a perfect labyrinth that contains only a single path between the same two cells. The generated paths is always created randomly from the starting cell until all cells are linked together.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the starting vertex from which the rest of the labyrinth will be generated

      • getVertex

        public Vertex getVertex(int x,
                        int y)
        Returns a vertex from the vertices set. Returns null if the vertex is not within the set.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate on the horizontal axis
        y - coordinate on the vertical axis
        Returns:
        the corresponding vertex, if found

      • calculateManhattanDistance

        private void calculateManhattanDistance(Vertex source,
                                        Vertex target)
        Calculates the Manhattan distance using the Manhattan algorithm between two vertices.

        Should not be called. Use launchManhattan instead.

        Parameters:
        source - starting vertex
        target - goal vertex

      • launchManhattan

        public void launchManhattan(Vertex source,
                            Vertex target)
        Prepares the vertices for a Manhattan algorithm sweep through and launches the algorithm.
        Parameters:
        source - starting vertex
        target - goal vertex

      • isWall

        public boolean isWall(Vertex vertex,
                      Labyrinth.Directions dir)
        Check if there is a wall in the specified direction from a given vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - checked vertex
        dir - checked direction
        Returns:
        a boolean which is true if there is a wall, false otherwise

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed(Vertex vertex,
                        Labyrinth.Directions dir)
        Check if the player can go in the specified direction from a given vertex or if something is blocking the way.
        Parameters:
        vertex - starting vertex
        dir - checked direction
        Returns:
        a boolean which is true if there is an obstacle, false otherwise

      • isOpened

        public boolean isOpened(Vertex vertex,
                        Labyrinth.Directions dir)
        Check if the player can go in the specified direction from a given vertex or if something is blocking the way.
        Parameters:
        vertex - starting vertex
        dir - checked direction
        Returns:
        a boolean which is true if there is no obstacle, false otherwise

      • isClosedDoor

        public boolean isClosedDoor(Vertex vertex,
                            Labyrinth.Directions dir)
        Check if there is a closed door at the specified direction from the given vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - starting vertex
        dir - checked direction
        Returns:
        a boolean which is true if there is a closed door, false otherwise

      • isOpenedDoor

        public boolean isOpenedDoor(Vertex vertex,
                            Labyrinth.Directions dir)
        Check if there is an opened door at the specified direction from the given vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - starting vertex
        dir - checked direction
        Returns:
        a boolean which is true if there is an opened door, false otherwise

      • getVertexByDir

        public Vertex getVertexByDir(Vertex vertex,
                             Labyrinth.Directions dir)
        Return the vertex located at the specified direction from the given vertex. Returns null if the target vertex is not found.
        Parameters:
        vertex - starting vertex
        dir - direction from the starting vertex
        Returns:
        the desired vertex if it exists

      • getInstance

        public static Labyrinth getInstance()
        Get an instance of the object Labyrinth. Needed because we are using the Singleton Design Pattern.
        Returns:
        the current instance of this class

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String version of the content of the labyrinth.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the graph

      • printLabyrinth

        public void printLabyrinth()
        Prints a graphical representation of the labyrinth to the console.

      • areVerticesConnected

        public boolean areVerticesConnected(int xs,
                                    int ys,
                                    int xt,
                                    int yt)
        Check if two vertices are connected by verifying if the labyrinth contains a edge between them.
        Parameters:
        xs - Horizontal localisation of the source vertex
        ys - Vertical localisation of the source vertex
        xt - Horizontal localisation of the target vertex
        yt - Vertical localisation of the target vertex
        Returns:
        True if the vertices are connected, false if they're not.

      • getVertices

        public java.util.Set<Vertex> getVertices()
        Return the set of vertices contained in the labyrinth.
        Returns:
        a vertex set.

      • getPaths

        public java.util.Set<Edge> getPaths()
        Return the set of edges contained in the labyrinth.
        Returns:
        a edge set.

      • getWalls

        public java.util.Set<java.util.List<Vertex>> getWalls()
        Return all the walls contained in the labyrinth.
        Returns:
        a vertex list set.

      • openDoorRandom

        public void openDoorRandom()
        Opens a random door in order to change the difficulty of the game.

      • randomVertex

        private Vertex randomVertex()
        Finds a random vertex and returns it.
        Returns:
        a random vertex.

      • setLabyrinthGraph

        public void setLabyrinthGraph(org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph<Vertex,Edge> graph)
        A setter used in the JUnit tests. We need it because we're using a Singleton design pattern for the Labyrinth.
        Parameters:
        graph - a SimpleGraph to be injected in the Labyrinth.

      • getLabyrinthGraph

        public org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph<?,?> getLabyrinthGraph()
        A getter used in the JUnit tests. We need it because we're using a Singleton design pattern for the Labyrinth.
        Returns:
        a SimpleGraph representing the Labyrinth.
